intro: Pilea sumideroensis, commonly known as the Sumidero pilea, is a species of flowering plant native to the humid forests of South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a subject of interest for botanists and plant enthusiasts.
